actions.text: Referred to House Committee on International Relations.

official_title: Concurrent resolution calling for freedom and self-determination for Lithuania, Latvia, and Estonia.

summary.text: Calls upon the President to take all steps necessary to bring the Baltic States question before the United Nations. Provides that until the liberation of the Baltic States, the United States Information Agency shall do its utmost to bring the matter of the Baltic States to the attention of world opinion. Expresses the sense of the Congress that no United States delegation to any international conference shall agree to recognition of the Soviet Union's annexation of Lithuania, Latvia, and Estonia. Calls upon the President to request of all map publishers that all maps of Europe published in the United States shall show those Baltic nations as independent states. Calls for free elections conducted under the auspices of the United Nations, in all nations subjugated by Soviet communism.

titles.title: Concurrent resolution calling for freedom and self-determination for Lithuania, Latvia, and Estonia.
